result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus D Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.   Any remaining fine due is waived by the court.
Bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus D Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus D Johnson in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following to count #2:
FINE: $379.00 Bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: $200.00 Bail to be applied
Court waives the additional $79.00 due an owing.  
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant Marcus D Johnson in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  Parties make statements.  Court schedules this case for a sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus D Johnson in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus D Johnson not in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Schleis appears as a friend to the court as he is not yet appointed on this case.  Court addresses the nonappearance of the defendant.  Court checks to see if the defendant is in custody, he is not, he was released from the Waukesha County Jail on 9/14/2015.  Court revokes/forfeits bail.  Court issues a capias, cashbail in the amount of $1,000.00.  Case recalled at 10:48 am. Defendant appeared late.  Court questions why the defendant was late.  Court tried to contact Attorney Schleis but couldnt reach him.  Court vacates its prior order revoking/forefeiting bail.  Court vacates the capias ordered.  Defendant is to go directly to the public defenders office after court.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Tracy K. to include her place of employment or her residence.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Marcus D Johnson in court.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Defendant allowed non collect calls.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant to be seen by the public defender. 
  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
